snippet: The European Commission accused the company of setting artificially high fees for credit card transactions in the Continent.
abstract: Europe antitrust officials file charges against MasterCard, accusing firm of setting artificially high fees for credit card transactions in European Union.
lead_paragraph: The European Commission accused the company of setting artificially high fees for credit card transactions in the Continent.

headline.main: MasterCard Faces Antitrust Charges in E.U.
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Europe Charges MasterCard Over High Transaction Fees
